question.title: Quarkus: is there a way to register bean without any @Produces and other annotations?
question.body:
Is there a way to register bean into bean container without any annotation like @Producer, @ApplicationScoped and so on?

I know there is a way to do it in Spring, but I can't find any way how to do it in Quarkus.

Unfortunately I have to register beans during some business case and I can't use annotation like @Producer etc.

What I have as an example:

if (isApplied) {
    Config configuration = configService.createConfig();
    // Register configuration as a bean with bean name
    // to have ability to Inject it after
}

And this part of code I have not at startup. It's during REST API execution.
